constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 17 (Thursday, January 28, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mrs. WAGNER:
H.R. 619.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
(1) section 5 of the 14th Amendment, including the power
to enforce the prohibition on government action denying equal
protection of the laws; and (2) section 8 of article I to
make all laws necessary and proper for carrying into
execution the powers vested by the Constitution of the United
States, including the power to regulate commerce under clause
3 of such section.
[Page H253]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

title: Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act
